value.title: Millions of Indians are getting connected to an internet they can’t use
value.excerpt: Most Indian businesses, banks, and government services develop their websites and apps in English and Hindi. What about the users who speak other languages?

value.title: Researchers find cutting-edge language models fall short in basic reasoning
value.excerpt: A new paper finds that even cutting-edge language models like OpenAI's GPT-3 perform poorly when it comes to commonsense reasoning.

value.title: Voice assistants don’t work for kids: The problem with speech recognition in the classroom
value.excerpt: Young "remote learners" often struggle to navigate the keyboards, menus, and interfaces required to make good on the promise of education technology.

value.title: Researchers’ data set pinpoints challenges adapting speech recognition models to new hardware
value.excerpt: Researchers developed a data set -- Libra-Adapt -- designed to show the challenges in adapting voice recognition models to new devices and settings.

value.title: How AI is impacting customer experience in fintech (VB Live)
value.excerpt: Learn how companies like MasterCard are implementing AI and NLP strategies that transform how fintech customer experience is done.

value.title: Glaxo’s biology research with novel Cerebras machine shows hardware may change how AI is done
value.excerpt: A novel computer system built by Cerebras Systems of Los Altos, California, is already leading to changes in the way drug giant Glaxo builds large neural nets for drug development.

value.title: We’re entering the AI twilight zone between narrow and general AI
value.excerpt: OpenAI's GPT-3 transcends the definition of narrow AI. It doesn't qualify as general AI, but it's the first clear sign that we've begun the shift.

value.title: Trump plans to collect DNA, eye scans, and voice prints from immigrants
value.excerpt: The Trump administration's plans to expand the collection of biometric data from immigrants would let the government "surveil and target our communities."

value.title: Past The AI Hype: When Is AI Actually Profitable?
value.excerpt: One of the most important value drivers of machine learning and artificial intelligence technology isn't the technology itself. It's where a company deploys it.

value.title: A notorious GPT-3-generated blog shows AI still can’t imitate human writing
value.excerpt: So you’re interested in AI? Then join our online event, TNW2020, where you’ll hear how artificial intelligence is transforming industries and businesses. Last week, many tech publications broke news about a blog generated by artificial intelligence that fooled thousands of users and landed on top of the Hacker News forum.

value.title: How Amazon’s new health tracker will use AI to monitor your tone of voice
value.excerpt: Amazon's Halo will include a feature called Tone that offers users feedback about how happy or tired they sound.

value.title: 7 data science certifications to boost your resume and salary
value.excerpt: IBM, Google, SAS, and Oracle offer online courses and exams to quantify data science skills and expertise with modeling and analysis software.

value.title: Deepfake reality check: AI avatars set to transform business and education outreach
value.excerpt: AI avatars and synthetic video production could provide organizations with entirely new capabilities for training and multilingual global communication in the years ahead.

value.title: IBM will use AI to pipe in simulated crowd noise during the U.S. Open
value.excerpt: IBM plans to apply AI and machine learning solutions to new challenges brought on by the pandemic during the 140th U.S. Open.

value.title: US Open won't have spectators, but it will have IBM's AI and hybrid cloud
value.excerpt: Fans will be able to use IBM's new tech features as they watch the Grand Slam event from home this year.  This year, IBM has developed three new tennis-based digital experiences for fans of the US Open.

value.title: IBM hopes to power US Open's digital experiences with Watson's natural language processing
value.excerpt: The US Open can't have fans this year so IBM is hoping it can use AI to fuel debates, experiences and even the noise in the stadium.

value.title: Speech Recognition Gets an AutoML Training Tool
value.excerpt: AutoML, the application of machine learning to create new automation tools, is branching out to new use cases, making itself useful for particularly tedious data science tasks when training speech recognition models.

value.title: How a Scots Wikipedia scandal highlighted AI’s data problem
value.excerpt: A Reddit user discovered that most articles aren't written in Scots, raising questions for AI models trained on Wikipedia data.

value.title: These Are The Startups Applying AI To Transform Healthcare
value.excerpt: Of the many ways in which AI will transform our lives in the coming years, its impact may be more profound and far-reaching in healthcare than in any other field.

value.excerpt: Microsoft today announced the general availability of Immersive Reader, a service that enables apps to present text in more digestible and accessible ways.
